name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. Israel SANTIAGO, Appellant (two cases)

judges: Before EAGEN, C. J., and O’BRIEN, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
ROBERTS, J., did not participate in the consideration or decision of this case.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. Israel SANTIAGO, Appellant (two cases).

opinions.text:
OPINION OF THE COURT
PER CURIAM.
Judgment of sentence vacated and case remanded for evidentiary hearing on the question of ineffective assistance of trial counsel. See, e. g., Commonwealth v. Hubbard, 472 Pa. 259, 372 A.2d 687 (1977).
ROBERTS, J., did not participate in the consideration or decision of this case.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Neil E. Jokelson, Philadelphia, for appellant.
F. Emmett Fitzpatrick, Dist. Atty., Steven H. Goldblatt, Gaele Barthold, Asst. Dist. Attys., for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
373 A.2d 455
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. Israel SANTIAGO, Appellant (two cases).
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued April 19, 1977.
Decided June 3, 1977.
Neil E. Jokelson, Philadelphia, for appellant.
F. Emmett Fitzpatrick, Dist. Atty., Steven H. Goldblatt, Gaele Barthold, Asst. Dist. Attys., for appellee.
Before EAGEN, C. J., and O’BRIEN, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
